alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 12:04AM EST until February 26 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...From early this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Low lying roads flood. Manchester street floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EST Thursday the stage was 25.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning and continue to a crest of 27.5 feet by this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage by this evening. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 11 AM Friday.
